page.title: 13PARTHINGS FARM,HORSHAM
page.content: Parthings farm is one of the oldest buildings around{Tower Hill.}It was built in the{fourteenth century}but its{granary}was built even earlier. Originally there was just a hole in the roof to let out smoke from a fire. The chimney was added later when they first came into use. The granary is used now as a store room. The farmhouse is made from wood, and {Horsham stone}from nearby quarries. The stone quarries have since been filled in though some are still visible. Inside the house there are exposed wooden beams,Tudor style. Very recently the{Horsham housing {development}has been spreading closer and closer to Parthings as the owner sells off parcels of land for development. Will Parthings be in the country much longer?
